hint.text: If the cells double itself every hour, in 5 hours it would have doubled itself 5 times, find this amount.

solution.text:
Initial number cells \(= 1\)
The cells double itself every hour.
Hence, the number of cells after 5 hours will be \(2^5 \times 1\)
\(=32\)

content.text: The cells of a bacteria double itself every hour. How many cells will there be after 5 hours, if initially we start with 1 cell?
